Quiz.Name: ORACLE JAVA QUIZ 1
Quiz.Summary: This practice test contains 15 java questions with answer explanations to help you test your Java skills and prepare for the Oracle Certified Associate - Java Programmer exam.

Answer.Explanation: Wrong answer. The value of 'i' starts with 0.

Answer.Text: An exception could be thrown at runtime.
Answer.Explanation: Wrong answer. There is no way of throwing exceptions (there is no arrayOutOfBoundException).

Correct! The length of array 'a' is 6, so the value of the variable 'i' is 5. Execution of the while loop will print the array elements in reverse order because the variable 'i' has an initial value of 5. So printing of the elements starts with 6 (a[5]) and runs until the value of variable 'i' equals 0. Therefore the first element of the array 'a' (a[0]) prints last.
Wrong answer. The while loop goes through all elements.
Wrong answer. The while loop goes through all elements.
Wrong answer. An identifier cannot start with a number.
Correct! Identifiers can start with a letter, a dollar mark or an underscore. They can be any length.
Wrong answer. An identifier cannot start with @
Correct! Identifiers can start with a letter, a dollar mark or an underscore. They can be any length.
